content:
• Wednesday, June 11, 2014
  • ARNA

    Arena +3.7% AH; CEO declines comment on Eisai speculation

    • During a CNBC Fast Money appearance, Arena (NASDAQ:ARNA) CEO Jack Lief was tight-lipped about rumors Belviq partner Eisai (OTCPK:ESALY) is interested in acquiring his company.
    • Investors trying to read between the lines see reasons to be hopeful.
    • Lief also mentioned Belviq prescriptions are seeing week/week growth.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:18 PM | 13 Comments
  • KEYW

    KEYW Holding +8.6% AH on new government deal

    • An unnamed "leading U.S. government agency" has taken initial delivery of KEYW Holding's HawkEye G threat-detection/malware-removal solution.
    • Last month, Chardan cited strong sales of HawkEye G, which analyzes host/network data (with the help of a data warehouse) to spot malicious code, as a reason for upgrading KEYW.
    • Chairman/CEO Leonard Moodispaw bought more shares last week.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:58 PM

  • After Hour Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: RH +12.2%. TIBX +4.9%. OTC:LIN +3.9%. MYGN +3.3%. ELNK +2.7%.
    • Top losers, as of 5:15 p.m.: VTSS -8.4%. CHS -5.2%. SIGM -4.5%. ARIA -4.3%. APU -4.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM | 3 Comments
  • EPRS

    Zalicus +43.5% AH; Epirus releases positive BOW015 data

    • A Phase 3 study on the efficacy and safety of Epirus' BOW015 rheumatoid arthritis drug relative to the currently-available Remicade "met its pre-specified statistical endpoint," and found "no meaningful differences observed in safety or immunogenicity."
    • Results from the open label testing phase, including "one year immunogenicity, one year safety, and long-term responder rates," are expected in Q3.
    • Epirus merger partner Zalicus (ZLCS) is responding quite well to the news.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM | 6 Comments
  • PBF

    PBF Energy in 18M-share secondary offering

    • PBF Energy (NYSE:PBF) -3.4% AH after announcing a secondary offering of 18M common shares held by funds affiliated with the Blackstone Group and First Reserve Management.
    • PBF will receive no proceeds from the offering.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • TIBX

    Tibco +4.9% AH; activist discloses stake, wants changes

    • In an open letter to Tibco's (NASDAQ:TIBX) board, Praesidium Investment discloses a 5.5M-share (3.4%) stake, declares Tibco to be "falling far short of its significant potential," and says it will continue to "actively engage the Board and assist it in exploring value-enhancing ideas."
    • Notably, Praesidium lists "potential acquirers" among the groups it plans to share its Tibco views with going forward.
    • Tibco is only 8 days removed from issuing an FQ2 warning blamed on weak Spotfire sales. SAP was previously rumored to be a potential acquirer, but the company has since said it's not currently looking to make a big acquisition.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:15 PM
  • RH

    Restoration +12.1% AH on FQ1 beat, strong guidance

    • Restoration Hardware (NYSE:RH) expects FQ2 revenue of $443M-$453M and EPS of $0.62-$0.64 vs. a consensus of $452.1M and $0.61. FY15 (ends Jan. '15) guidance is for revenue of $1.86B-$1.89B and EPS of $2.24-$2.30, above a consensus of $1.85B and $2.20.
    • Comparable brand revenue +18% Y/Y in FQ1 vs. +24% in FQ4. Direct revenue (48% of total) +24% vs. +33%. Retail store count fell by 1 Q/Q and Y/Y to 69.
    • Gross margin was 34%, -310 bps Q/Q and +20 bps Y/Y. SG&A spend was 32.7% of revenue, down from 33.6% a year ago.
    • Shares are making new highs AH.
    • FQ1 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM
  • APU

    Energy Transfer affiliate to offer 8.5M AmeriGas units

    • AmeriGas Partners (NYSE:APU) -4.4% AH says an affiliate of Energy Transfer Partners (ETP) commenced a public offering of 8.5M APU common units it currently holds.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM | 2 Comments
  • VTSS

    Vitesse -3.9% AH after announcing stock offering

    • Vitesse (NASDAQ:VTSS) hasn't disclosed the offering's size.
    • The networking/telecom chipmaker has posted a long string of losses; 2013 free cash flow was -$10.4M. Vitesse ended Q1 with $48.2M in cash, and an equal amount of debt.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • RH

    Restoration Hardware beats by $0.07, beats on revenue

    • Restoration Hardware (NYSE:RH): Q1 EPS of $0.18 beats by $0.07.
    • Revenue of $366.3M (+21.6% Y/Y) beats by $17.81M.
    • Shares +7.9% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • NEWL

    NewLead +23% as judge denies preliminary injunction vs. Ironridge

    • NewLead Holdings (NEWL +23.1%) spikes into the close after a U.S. judge denies a preliminary injunction to stop Ironridge Global IV from obtaining more NEWL shares to satisfy various liabilities.
    • The judge says he lacks personal jurisdiction over Ironridge, and NEWL has not shown it deserves preliminary relief; the action dissolves a temporary restraining order issued earlier this month and closes the case.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 5 Comments
  • ROIC

    Retail Opportunity Investments announces 12.5M share secondary

    • The proceeds will initially be used to pay down borrowings from the company's $350M unsecured credit facility.
    • ROIC -2.7% AH
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • ORMP

    Traders taking positions ahead of Oramed's presentations

    • Shares of thinly-traded Oramed Pharmaceuticals (ORMP +20.3%) jump on a 2x surge in volume though the total turnover is only ~240K shares. Prices have improved ~61% since the May 28 low of $6.72. Next week, the company presents three abstracts at the American Diabetes Association meeting on ORMD-0801, its orally ingestible insulin capsule.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM | 1 Comment
  • LKM

    NQ Mobile -11.7% after false report, lack of 20-F timetable

    • A false report (attributed to a fake Xinhua Twitter account) stated NQ Mobile (NQ) had fired auditor PwC. NQ has since affirmed PwC remains its auditor, but has added it still has no timetable for filing its delayed annual report (form 20-F).
    • Shares have now given back most of the huge gains they saw a week ago after NQ released its special committee's findings, and are down 44% YTD.
    • Debate on SA remains fierce. Quoth the Raven thinks a still-pending financial audit from PwC "could be a lose/lose situation for NQ." Justin Giles thinks NQ will likely receive an unqualified audit that fully clears the company.
    • Yesterday: NQ Mobile sells stake in NationSky
     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM | 7 Comments
  • LXU

    LSB +3% on review of strategic separations, potential MLP for chemicals unit

    • LSB Industries (LXU +3.1%) surges to 52-week highs following a disclosure that it established a strategic committee to assist in reviewing and evaluating potential separations of business units and possibility of placing some or all of its chemical business into an MLP structure.
    • The news is not a total surprise, since activist investor Starboard Value reached an agreement with the company in April to get two seats on the board.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM
  • BDSI

    BioDelivery breaks out

    • Shares of BioDelivery Sciences International (BDSI +14.3%) break out of a cup-with-a-handle base on a 4x surge in volume. Investors apparently like the company's prospects after the FDA approval of Bunavail.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • ANV

    SEC says fugitive profited from fake bid for Allied Nevada

    • The man behind a fake $750M bid this past January for Allied Nevada Gold (ANV +5.9%) profited from selling an undisclosed stake in the company and has fled the country, the SEC says.
    • Luis Chang is now in China, according to the SEC, which is seeking the return of profits from the alleged scheme and unspecified monetary penalties; a U.S. district judge today ordered a freeze of Chang's assets.
    • Shares may be higher on reports of a May jump in short interest, up nearly 1% from the previous month and representing ~36% of ANV's total shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM
  • TLM

    Talisman Energy, Pertamina in talks on possible stake in Duvernay gas fields

    • Indonesia’s state-run PT Pertamina says it has held early-stage talks with Talisman Energy (TLM +2.6%) about acquiring a stake in the Duvernay shale gas acreage in Alberta.
    • TLM has been seeking a partner to develop its Duvernay holdings as it looks to raise as much as $2B from asset sales over the next 12-18 months to cut debt.
    • Acquiring a stake in TLM’s Alberta gas fields would be Pertamina’s first foray into Canada’s oil and gas industry.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • JIVE

    Jive Software pops on CEO's purchase

    • Jive Software (JIVE +5.1%) chairman/CEO Tony Zingale discloses he bought 100K shares yesterday at $7.55.
    • The disclosure comes as Jive remains down over 50% from a 52-week high of $18.48 thanks to earnings disappointments and competitive worries.
    • Re/code reported in March Jive has hired famous tech banker Frank Quattrone to help find a buyer, albeit while adding Oracle, SAP, and Workday all chose to pass.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM
  • VER

    American Realty price target cut at BofA

    • "We're gaining confidence in David Kay's (expected to be CEO by the end of they year) ability to continue to address concerns and build investor confidence, including adding personnel to financial reporting," writes Bank of America, reiterating its Buy rating on American Realty Capital Properties (ARCP -2.3%), but lowering the price target by a quarter to $15.25.
    • Recent positives: Deleveraged the balance sheet, sold the shopping center portfolio, and internalized management.
    • Investor concerns? Activist rumblings at American Capital
     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM | 16 Comments
  • RVLT

    Revolution Lighting +5.1% on new LED retrofit deal

    • Top NYC commercial property owner SL Green will use Revolution Lighting's (NASDAQ:RVLT) Seesmart LED tube lamps at 9 office properties featuring 6.2M sq. feet of space.
    • The deal follows retrofits in 2012 and 2013 at 24 SL Green properties. The latest retrofit is expected to yield $370K/year in annual cost savings.
    • Revolution is bouncing after closing yesterday near its 52-week low of $2.01.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM
  • UNFI

    Weak guidance a hindrance at United Natural Foods

    • United Natural Foods (UNFI -8.4%) slips after the company posts in-line results.
    • Guidance from the company just below analyst expectations has soured sentiment on the stock.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Top 10 Gainers: CNAT +48%. BIOF +40%. SYNA +27%. MXC +23%. SR-OLD +16%. GLMD +16%. NFEC +15%. OTCQB:NWBO +15%. GERN +15%. ULTA +14%.
    • Top 10 Losers: TBBK -28%. OREX -17%. CXDC -12%. NQ -11%. UNFI -8%. SC -9%. OTC:ENZN -8%. WH-OLD -7%. NTLS -7%. ACHN -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • APC

    Anadarko hits 52-week highs as takeover speculation swirls

    • Anadarko Petroleum (APC +3.1%) moves to 52-week highs before pulling back a bit amid speculation it may be the subject of takeover interest from Exxon Mobil (XOM +0.6%).
    • APC has “an asset base that would be coveted by any large player looking to make that kind of a splash," says a Raymond James analyst. "The question would be, is now the time for that?"
    • APC says it doesn't comment on rumors.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM | 13 Comments
  • MM

    Millennial Media rises after poaching Google exec

    • Millennial Media (MM +4.3%) has hired Marc Theermann, formerly head of Google's mobile platform sales, to be its EVP of business strategy.
    • At Google, Theermann was responsible for driving sales for DoubleClick's mobile publishers' platform and ad exchange, and for Google's AdMob mobile display ad unit (directly competes with Millennial).
    • His duties at Millennial will include "[accelerating] the company's position [within] programmatic and native advertising," two fast-growing segments. Twitter's MoPub unit (also competes with Millennial) recently bought native ad platform Namo Media.
    • In May, Millennial announced CFO Michael Avon is departing to pursue other opportunities. The news came as the company issued ugly Q2 guidance to go with mixed Q1 results.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM
  • PVAC

    Positive Penn Virginia well results should outweigh offering, SunTrust says

    • Penn Virginia (PVA +1.7%) reverses large early losses to turn higher despite yesterday's announcement after the close that it would offer $250M of depositary shares that can be converted into preferred stock.
    • The catalyst for the turnaround appears to be a SunTrust note that calls the move positive, as 2015 oil production growth should now be ~40% vs. ~30% previously and total Eagle Ford acreage is likely to reach 100K quicker than forecast.
    • In a self-fulfilling prophecy, SunTrust predicted shares would rebound when the likely positive well results are understood.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM | 1 Comment
  • MONT

    Montage accepts $22.60/share buyout offer

    • Montage (MONT +8.7%) has agreed to be acquired by state-owned firm PDSTI for  $22.60/share in cash, or $693M.
    • The deal, still subject to shareholder vote, values Montage at 6.2x 2013 sales. The chipmaker currently trades 5% below PDSTI's offer price.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM
  • BA

    Boeing -2.3% following downgrade, Airbus order cancellation

    • Boeing (BA -2.3%) is easily the Dow's biggest decliner today following two pieces of bad news - one specific to Boeing, the other to the airline industry.
    • RBC downgraded BA shares to Sector Perform from Outperform, believing most of the good news already is out and reflected in the stock; Boeing "has become an execution/cash deployment vs. an upside to growth story, and this is likely to cap any multiple expansion from here," RBC writes.
    • Also, today's surprise cancellation of an Airbus (OTCPK:EADSF -2.9%) order raises questions over new aircraft demand, whether for the Airbus A350 or a more general wobble of confidence in a previously solid market that could also hit Boeing.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM | 11 Comments
  • SKUL

    Piper upgrade boosts Skullcandy

    • Citing confidence in Skullcandy's (SKUL +3.1%) new headphone lineup, Piper has upgraded shares to Neutral. Its PT is at $7.50.
    • SA author Charles Moscoe has been more critical of Skullcandy's product line, noting margins have come under pressure thanks to tough competition and high channel inventories. The company's North American sales (+1.3% Y/Y in Q1) remain soft, but its international sales (+19.7%) are faring better.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM
  • DLAKY

    Soft outlook from Lufthansa stings airline stocks

    • A revised outlook from Lufthansa (OTCQX:DLAKY) is pressuring other airline stocks today.
    • Pricing competition from Middle East carriers on long hauls to and from Europe is a rising concern for Lufthansa and creating a ripple effect for other routes.
    • Decliners: Delta Air Lines (NYSE:DAL) -3.6%, Alaska Air Group (NYSE:ALK) -2.0%, United Continental (NASDAQ:UAL) -3.7%, Hawaiian Holdings (NASDAQ:HA) -2.5%, American Airlines (NASDAQ:AAL) -2.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM | 9 Comments
  • RMBS

    Rambus +5% on Qualcomm deal, guidance hike

    • Rambus (NASDAQ:RMBS) has struck a licensing deal with mobile chip giant Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM) that covers its memory, interface, and security IP. Terms are undisclosed.
    • As part of the deal, Qualcomm is licensing Rambus' new CryptoManager chip security platform, which (through a core integrated within an SoC) provides "a hardware root-of-trust for the secure provisioning, configuration, keying, and authentication of SoCs during chip and device manufacturing."
    • Qualcomm's chip division had FY13 (ended Sep. '13) revenue of $16.7M, and claims over 60% of the baseband processor market. Thus, even a small per-chip royalty could add up.
    • With the Qualcomm deal on the books, Rambus now expects Q2 revenue of $75M-$77M, up from a prior $69M-$74M and above a $71.4M consensus. Full-year guidance of $295M-$305M is reiterated.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM
  • ANGI

    Angie's List brushes off Amazon, rallies on Wunderlich upgrade

    • Citing improving marketplace trends, Wunderlich has upgraded Angie's List (ANGI +3.6%) to Buy, and set a $15 PT.
    • BofA/Merrill upgraded Angie's 5 days ago, arguing growth remains healthy in many locales and the company has seen a positive response to its new tiered pricing model.
    • Shares fell yesterday following a Reuters report stating Amazon plans to join the already-sizable list of companies offering a local services marketplace, but recovered most of their losses by the close.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM
  • BYD

    Boyd Gaming settles with Atlantic City over tax credits

    • Boyd Gaming (BYD +4.9%) trades higher after the company reaches a settlement with the city of Atlantic City over tax credits.
    • The company will receive a tax refund of $88.25M for tax years 2011-2013 and a credit of $17.85M for this year.
    • SEC Form 8-K
     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM | 1 Comment
  • MRVL

    Marvell rises on 4G-driven Nomura upgrade

    • Nomura has upgraded Marvell (MRVL +2.8%) to Buy, and hiked its PT by $4 to $19. The firm is optimistic about the chipmaker's ability to grow its 4G baseband processor sales.
    • Better-than-expected baseband demand fueled Marvell's big FQ1 revenue beat. The company has scored a decent number of design wins with Chinese OEMs for phones running on China Mobile's new 4G TD-LTE network, and has also had its chips certified for use on AT&T and Verizon's networks.
    • Mobile/wireless sales (inc. Wi-Fi/Bluetooth combo chips) made up 33% of Marvell's FQ1 sales. Qualcomm still claims the lion's share of the 4G baseband market, aided by leads in multi-band support and high-end app processor integration.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM
  • MU

    Micron +4.1%, SanDisk +0.9% on two-notch BofA/Merrill upgrades

    • BofA/Merrill has upgraded Micron (NASDAQ:MU) and SanDisk (SNDK) to Buy from Underperform. Its Micron PT has been upped by $18 to $40, and its SanDisk PT by $45 to $125.
    • Analyst Simon Dong-je Woo, who struck a much more cautious stance on Micron in a March note, now thinks "further upside" is likely (in spite of a 33% YTD gain) thanks to solid industry pricing and Micron's cost-competitiveness.
    • His FY15/16 EPS estimates have been raised by ~50% on average, and he expects a dividend payment by the end of FY15 (ends Aug. '15).
    • Also: Cresit Suisse has upped its Micron PT by $20 to $50 (a Street high), arguing the memory giant can eventually sustain EPS of $5.
    • Woo downgraded Micron to Underperform on Dec. 23, when shares were at $22.17.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM | 13 Comments
  • CBS

    Reaction to CBS split-off of CBS Outdoor Americas

    • Shares of CBS (NYSE:CBS) move higher in premarket action after the company decides to divest CBS Outdoor Americas (CBSO) earlier than anticipated.
    • Wells Fargo is out with early commentary on the development. The firm says the early conversion of CBS Outdoor to a REIT is a positive and likes the implications for CBS shareholders.
    • Media industry insiders like the visibility the split-off will help present for CBS shareholders.
    • CBS +1.4% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: BIOF +37%. SYNA +20%. ULTA +12%. OTCQB:NWBO +10%. RMBS +8%. OSUR +6%. END +6%. AMRN +5%.
    • Losers: TBBK -30%. OREX -15%. AUXL -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM | 1 Comment
  • SN

    Sanchez Energy to offer 5M shares, $700M in senior notes

    • Sanchez Energy (NYSE:SN) -3.7% premarket after announcing a public offering of 5M common shares with a 30-day option to purchase up to an additional 750K shares, as well as a private offering of $700M in senior notes.
    • SN says it intends to use the proceeds from the offerings to partially fund its pending Catarina acquisition and for general corporate purposes.
    • SN also has filed to offer ~6.28M common shares by selling shareholders; the company will receive no proceeds from the sale of stock by the selling stockholders.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM | 1 Comment
  • BIOF

    BioFuel Energy to acquire JBGL in $275M deal, shares +23% premarket

    • BioFuel Energy (NASDAQ:BIOF) +23.1% premarket after agreeing to acquire JBGL Builder Finance from affiliates of Greenlight Capital and James Brickman for $275M in cash and stock.
    • The cash portion of the deal will be funded from the proceeds of a $70M rights offering and ~$150M in debt financing provided to BIOF by Greenlight.
    • JBGL is a series of real estate entities involved in the purchase and development of land for residential purposes, construction lending and home building operations.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:44 AM | 1 Comment
  • PGNX

    Progenix trading halted while Ad Comm meets

    • The NASDAQ halts trading of Progenix Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:PGNX) while the FDA's Anesthetic and Analgesic Drug Products Ad Comm meets today and tomorrow to discuss the potential cardiovascular risks associated with peripherally-acting opioid receptor agonists and the design and size of cardiovascular outcomes trials needed to support the approval of drugs in the class for the indication of opioid-induced constipation (OIC).
    • The Ad Comm meeting was originally announced in June 2013 in response to an appeal by Progenics' collaboration partner Salix Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SLXP) of a CRL it received in July 2012 regarding its NDA for Relistor (methylnaltrexone bromide) for the treatment of opioid-induced constipation in patients with chronic non-cancer pain.
    • The FDA stated that it will take action under the appeal within 30 days after receiving input from the Advisory Committee.
    • Trading in Nektar Therapeutics (NASDAQ:NKTR) has been halted as well. Its product candidate for OIC is Movantik (naloxegol oxalate).
    • Briefing docs
     
     
     
     
    | 8:28 AM | 1 Comment
  • RAI

    BofA sees upside for Reynolds American

    • Reynolds American (NYSE:RAI) is upgraded by Bank of America to a Buy rating from Neutral.
    • The investment firm gives shares a premium due to a potential merger of Reynolds with Lorillard.
    • Favorable industry pricing trends in Q2 also set up well for Reynolds.
    • RAI +0.2% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 8:17 AM
